Package fr.sekelenao.skcsv

Class SkCsv

java.lang.Object
fr.sekelenao.skcsv.SkCsv
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<SkCsvRow>
public class SkCsv extends Object implements Iterable<SkCsvRow>
Represents a CSV (Comma-Separated Values) file consisting of multiple rows. This class provides methods to manipulate and access rows within the CSV.

Instances of this class use a default configuration SEMICOLON with a semicolon as the delimiter and double quotes for quoting fields. The configuration can be customized as needed.

Unlike individual rows, which implement RandomAccess, this class does not guarantee constant time access.

Null values are not permitted in instances of this class, ensuring consistency in data processing.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    SkCsv()
    Constructs an empty SkCsv instance with the default configuration SEMICOLON with a semicolon as the delimiter and double quotes for quoting fields.
    SkCsv(SkCsvRow... rows)
    Constructs an SkCsv instance initialized with the specified rows and the default configuration SEMICOLON with a semicolon as the delimiter and double quotes for quoting fields.
    SkCsv(Iterable<SkCsvRow> rows)
    Constructs an SkCsv instance initialized with the specified iterable of row and the default configuration SEMICOLON with a semicolon as the delimiter and double quotes for quoting fields.

  • Constructor Details

    • SkCsv

      public SkCsv()
      Constructs an empty SkCsv instance with the default configuration SEMICOLON with a semicolon as the delimiter and double quotes for quoting fields.

    • SkCsv

      public SkCsv(SkCsvRow... rows)
      Constructs an SkCsv instance initialized with the specified rows and the default configuration SEMICOLON with a semicolon as the delimiter and double quotes for quoting fields.

      The provided array of rows is copied, so subsequent changes to the array do not affect this SkCsv instance.

      Parameters:
      rows - the array of rows to initialize the CSV
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the specified array or any of its elements is null

    • SkCsv

      public SkCsv(Iterable<SkCsvRow> rows)
      Constructs an SkCsv instance initialized with the specified iterable of row and the default configuration SEMICOLON with a semicolon as the delimiter and double quotes for quoting fields.

      The provided iterable of rows is copied, so subsequent changes to the iterable do not affect this SkCsv instance.

      Parameters:
      rows - the iterable of rows to initialize the CSV
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the specified iterable or any of its elements is null

    • insert

      public void insert(int position, SkCsvRow row)
      Inserts a single row at the specified position in this SkCsv instance.

      Note: This method does not provide constant-time access (O(1)). If the function needs to be called multiple times, using a ListIterator via the listIterator() method may be preferable.

      Parameters:
      position - the position at which the row is to be inserted
      row - the row to be inserted
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the position is invalid
      NullPointerException - if the specified row is null

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object other)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this SkCsv instance.

      This method returns true if the specified object is also a SkCsv instance, both instances have the same number of rows, and all corresponding pairs of rows are equal. In other words, two SkCsv instances are defined to be equal if they contain the same rows in the same order.

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      other - the reference object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this SkCsv instance is equal to the specified object, false otherwise
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the specified object is null

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Returns the hash code value for this SkCsv instance.

      This method computes a hash code based on the number of rows and the hash codes of all rows.

      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      the hash code value for this SkCsv instance

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this SkCsv instance.

      This method returns a string containing the CSV representation of all rows in this SkCsv instance, separated by newlines. The CSV formatting is performed using the current configuration of this SkCsv instance.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of this SkCsv instance
